page.title: 02History
page.content: The history of the area goes back to Roman times and there was a Roman Villa at GR 534134 from which pottery shards collected and recorded by the school were dated by the Woodstock Museum between the 2nd and 4th centuries BC.Scattered flints of Neolithic origin and a Saxon spearhead were also found on this site.In the NE corner of Islip there is the still recognisable site of a mediaeval manor house (the moat and fishponds are discernable).Edward the Confessor was born in Islip and gave "ye little Towne" to Westminster in whose gift it still remains.There was a battle for the bridge in the Civil War at which Cromwell himself was present.There were riots on Otmoor over the enclosures in the 19th century.The cry "Otmoor for ever" still rings through the area.
